questions.subject: physics
questions.text: Question 1: A particle moves along the x-axis such that its position as a function of time is given by x(t) = 4t³ - 6t² + 3t - 5, where x is in meters and t is in seconds. The acceleration of the particle at t = 2 s is:

questions.subject: physics
questions.text: Question 2: A body of mass 5 kg is moving with a velocity of 2 m/s. The kinetic energy of the body is:

questions.subject: physics
questions.text: Question 4: A body is thrown vertically upward with a velocity of 19.6 m/s. The maximum height reached by the body is: (g = 9.8 m/s²)

questions.subject: physics
questions.text: Question 5: Which of the following statements is/are correct about simple harmonic motion?
options: Option 1: The acceleration is proportional to displacement
Option 2: The total energy remains constant
Option 3: The velocity is maximum at the mean position
Option 4: The acceleration is maximum at the extreme positions

questions.subject: physics
questions.text: Question 6: Which of the following statements is/are correct about projectile motion?
options: Option 1: The horizontal component of velocity remains constant
Option 2: The vertical component of velocity changes uniformly
Option 3: The path followed is parabolic
Option 4: The acceleration is constant and equal to g

questions.subject: physics
questions.text: Question 7: Which of the following statements is/are correct about electromagnetic waves?
options: Option 2: They can travel through vacuum
Option 3: Their speed depends on the medium
Option 4: They carry energy and momentum

questions.subject: physics
questions.text: Question 8: A body of mass 2 kg is moving with a velocity of 10 m/s. If a constant force produces 100 W of power, the velocity (in m/s) of the body after 5 seconds will be:

questions.text: Question 9: A body is projected with a velocity of 20 m/s at an angle of 30° with the horizontal. The time of flight (in seconds) is: (g = 10 m/s²)

questions.text: Question 22: Which of the following statements is/are correct about benzene?
options: Option 1: It has a planar structure
Option 2: All carbon atoms are sp² hybridized
Option 3: It undergoes substitution reactions more readily than addition reactions
Option 4: It has a delocalized π-electron cloud

questions.subject: chemistry
questions.text: Question 23: Which of the following statements is/are correct about the periodic table?
options: Option 1: Atomic radius increases down a group
Option 2: Ionization energy decreases down a group
Option 3: Electronegativity increases across a period
Option 4: Metallic character decreases across a period

questions.subject: chemistry
questions.text: Question 24: Which of the following statements is/are correct about chemical equilibrium?
options: Option 1: The equilibrium constant depends on temperature
Option 2: Addition of a catalyst changes the equilibrium constant
Option 3: The equilibrium shifts in the forward direction when concentration of products is decreased
Option 4: The equilibrium constant is independent of pressure for reactions involving gases

Option 3: f(x) is continuous for all real x

Option 2: The sequence is bounded above
Option 4: The sequence diverges to infinity
